poem:
**The Price of Autos**

A tariff thick  
as October fog—  
metal ships  
bearing glossy  
creatures from afar—  
halt at our shores.  
The wheels of commerce  
slow, soft-spoken  
in the hard light  
of the Oval Room.  
A voice echoes—  
build here,  
or pay the price  
of silence.  
Steel whispers  
beneath its breath.
